name: Mercure Wolverhampton Goldthorn Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up staying here for a couple of nights while the car was being fixed in wolverhampton.
reviews.title: Characterful hotel with great staff

reviews.text: Hotel has been taken over by Mercure but isn't like any Mercure's I've stayed in on the continent.
reviews.title: Really good venue for business and leisure

reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Our room was in the main hotel and had obviously been refurbed quite recently, nice new bathroom and room fixtures/fittings, good bed.
reviews.title: More than happy to stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't think much of the pillows, very hard. Also the windows were painted shut so it might be a little uncomfortable in summer.
reviews.title: Did they really want our custom!

reviews.text: It was my mothers 80th birthday celebration, so my three sisters and myself booked this hotel for the night. We were all amazed at the standard of service we received from arrival to departure, nothing was too much trouble. we were in the "buisness" extention of the hotel. Our rooms were spacious,clean and comfortable with large bathrooms.We had a dinner bed and breakfast deal which was excellent value for money.The staff were all very helpful especially MR ADAMS who was the head waiter. we visited the Black Country Museum from here again the staff were most helpful in giving directions- all in all a GREAT time had by all !
reviews.title: good value hotel

reviews.text: So many staircases, firedoors, narrow corridors. Like a rabbit warren.
reviews.title: Not quite what it says on the packet!

reviews.title: Pettyness at its best, customer service at its worst.

reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.title: welcoming, relaxing, great place to stay

reviews.text: My self and my family had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Mercure Goldthorn hotel on Friday 17th June. As the hotel is now part of the Mercure brand I was expecting a pleasant stay however this was far from the case. I booked two rooms one for myself, my wife and my 4 year old daughter, and another for my parents on a dinner bed and breakfast rate for £95.95 per room.
reviews.title: Poor - Much improvement needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The experience did not start well when on arrival it was clear there was a large wedding party in the hotel and the bar area by reception was extremely crowded and noisy (we had not been informed in advance that there was likely to be disturbance in the hotel until we saw a note stuck up at reception on arrival).
reviews.title: Already planning our next visit

reviews.text: Check in went well and the staff behind the desk were friendly and efficient, we then headed for our room (26 I think) trying to fight our way through the wedding party to get to the steps. On arrival at the room, the first thing you noticed was the awful smell in the room, then on a quick inspection I soon realised the room looked very grubby with dirty walls (particularly above an electric heater where it was literally black). The room was clearly fairly worn with pealing wall paper and generally a shabby look. As the room was in such a state I went back to reception to ask to be moved, another room 58 was provided which was far better and clearly had higher quality fixtures and fittings. (just to note my parents room was in clear need of an update but was relatively adequate except the cracked panel in the side of the bath).
reviews.title: Excellent family hotel

reviews.text: Having finally settled in to the room we decided to go use the pool (one of the main reasons for picking this hotel), it could only be described as a nightmare, the place clearly needs a massive refurbishment, the changing rooms were only, dirty and did not have lockers you could actually lock unless you have your own padlock to hand. The area around the pool looked very grubby and worn out with dirty broken ceiling tiles (the pictures on the web site look much better than it in real life). Having finally got into the water it seemed ok and was fairly warm, however after about 15 minutes we all had to get out as we were all itching, and I had a rash appear on my arm, side and legs. We reported the problem to the reception who made a note but there did not seem to be a lot of action to go close the pool until it was looked at (I am glad to report after washing the pool water off the rash and itch went away after a couple of hours).
reviews.title: Fantastic Value!

reviews.text: Thinking nothing more could possibly go wrong we went for dinner feeling hungry, which was a shame because the food was very poor and far below expectation. The choice was something from the 80’s (starter options were soup, melon, prawn cocktail, or black pudding, main was 10 hour steamed gammon?, plaice, chicken dusted with Cajun spice, bolognaise, burger or stuffed pepper - or for a £4 supplement you could get 8oz rump steak - i don't think i have ever been anywhere before cheeky enough to ask for a supplement for rump steak. Desert was fruit salad, profiteroles or ice cream). The menu sad that 2 course was £16.95 and 3 courses was £19.99 - which is a complete joke, the food was of very poor quality. We did notice that there was a better menu available from the bar / for people who were not inclusive.
reviews.title: An absolute pleasure.

description: Within easy reach of M6/M54/M5 and NEC, the Mercure Wolverhampton Goldthorn Hotel offers some pleasant surprises. With original features throughout the bar area and a contemporary restaurant, the hotel provides an excellent setting from which to base your visit to the Midlands. There is also the opportunity to upgrade to one of six, four poster rooms, besides the other 76 well appointed en-suite bedrooms.
